Name: Alicorn
Details: The name for a winged unicorn.

Name: Banshee
Details: A spirit appearing as a frenzied old woman whose high pitched shriek prophesied a death soon to come.

Name: Basilisk
Details: A legendary lizard who could kill a man with its stare.

Name: Bigfoot
Details: A type of Sasquatch native to North American forests.

Name: Black Dog
Details: An evil spirit dog that stalks city streets at night.

Name: Black Eyed Beings
Details: They take human form but have black soulless eyes and emanate a sense of pure evil.

Name: Bogeyman
Details: A semi-corporeal being whose sole purpose is to scare children.

Name: Bogle
Details: A ghostly being whose purpose is to confuse and scare humans and other creatures.

Name: Bray Road Beast
Details: The nickname for a werewolf-like creature seen multiple times in Wisconsin.

Name: Centaur
Details: Half-men half-horse creatures that ran wild and unruly.

Name: Cerberus
Details: The three-headed dog that guards the entrance to Hades.

Name: Charybdis
Details: The whirlpool on one side of the Strait of Messina that swallowed ships that came too close to it.

Name: Chimera
Details: Part-lion part-goat part-snake all monster.

Name: Cockatrice
Details: A flying part-rooster/part-snake that could kill with its stare.

Name: Cyclops
Details: The one-eyed giant who captured and ate people.

Name: Cynocephalus
Details: A member of an ancient race of men with the heads of dogs.

Name: Demon
Details: Malevolent spirits of Hell who battle humans for control of their souls.

Name: Doppelganger
Details: Apparitions of people that occur in impossible situations.

Name: Dragon
Details: Giant flying fire-breathing lizards who often guard treasure.

Name: Dwarf
Details: A short stalky humanoid who live in underground mining communities.

Name: Echidna
Details: The snake-woman who became the mother of most Greek monsters.

Name: Elf
Details: A race of pointy-eared humanoids who excel in magic and archery.

Name: Fairy
Details: A small flying humanoid with magical abilities.

Name: Ghosts
Details: Spirits of the dead whose souls remain in the realm of the living.

Name: Gnome
Details: A small humanoid creature who lives and moves beneath the earth.

Name: Goblin
Details: A grotesque troublesome little creature with a strong greed for gold and jewels.

Name: Golem
Details: Magically animated human-shaped creatures typically made of solid stone.

Name: Gorgon
Details: The snake-haired and snake-bodied humanoid that was created in its mother's image. Its stare could turn a person to stone. Medusa became one of these creatures in a later myth.

Name: Griffin
Details: A creature with the body of a lion the tail of a snake and the head and wings of an eagle.

Name: Grim Reaper
Details: The embodiment of death itself the Grim Reaper comes to take your soul to the afterlife.

Name: Hobgoblin
Details: A type of Brownie who is inherently less helpful and more mischievous even to the point of causing harm if antagonized.

Name: Hydra
Details: The nine-headed serpent who grew two new heads for every one that was cut off.

Name: Imp
Details: Small mischievous creatures who liked to play pranks on people.

Name: Ladon (Python)
Details: The snake that guarded the golden apples in the Garden of the Hesperides.

Name: Leprechauns
Details: Small bearded men who have a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.

Name: Loch Ness Monster
Details: The elusive sea-monster from the Loch Ness in Scotland.

Name: Manticore
Details: A mythical beast with a lion's body and a human's head.

Name: Medusa
Details: A disciple of Athena who was turned into a gorgon.  She had the hair of snakes and could turn men to stone with her gaze.

Name: Mermaids
Details: Sea creatures with the head and torso of a woman and the tail of a fish.

Name: Minotaur
Details: The creature with the head and legs of a bull and the torso of a man who guarded the exit to The Labyrinth.

Name: Mothman
Details: A winged creature in the shape of a man with hypnotic red eyes sighted in West Virginia.

Name: Mutants
Details: A term describing abnormal creatures created by genetic or environmental mutations.

Name: Nemean Lion
Details: The giant lion with impenetrable hide who becomes the constellation Leo.

Name: New Jersey Devil
Details: A flying creature with a high-pitched scream and a horse-like head native to the New Jersey Pine Barrens.

Name: Nymph
Details: Divine female nature spirits who inhabit certain natural sites.

Name: Ogre
Details: An ugly oversized humanoid creature with great physical strength and little intelligence.

Name: Orthros
Details: The two-headed monster dog.

Name: Pegasus
Details: Technically the proper name of Bellerophon's winged horse which became the general name for winged horses.

Name: Phoenix
Details: The golden bird who at the end of its life burst into flames only to be reborn again.

Name: Pixie
Details: A small humanoid creature with pointy ears who likes to cause mischief.

Name: Sasquatch
Details: Large hairy man-like beasts that live in the woods.

Name: Satyr
Details: Half-men half-goats who were wild and lustful.  The god Pan was one of these.

Name: Scylla
Details: The man-eating beast that lived on the opposite side of the Strait of Messina from Charybdis.

Name: Sea Monsters
Details: The generic term for several breeds of water-based monsters.

Name: Sea-Goat
Details: The half-goat half-fish who are the children of Pricus who becomes the constellation Capricorn.

Name: Shade
Details: The ghosts of dead people before they are admitted entrance to Hades.

Name: Shapeshifters
Details: Humans who can willingly take the form of an animal while maintaining their consciousness.

Name: Sirens
Details: Man-eating beautiful women whose song compels men to them.

Name: Sphinx
Details: The half-human half-lion that forces those it meets to answer its riddles or die.

Name: Sprite
Details: A category of elemental fairy-like spirits invisible to humans (a Sylph is one of these).

Name: Sylph
Details: An invisible fairy-like being dedicated to the element of air.

Name: Thunderbird
Details: A giant bird that creates storms with its wings.

Name: Typhon
Details: The fire-breathing giant who challenged Zeus for control of Mount Olympus. Also the father of most Greek monsters.

Name: Unicorn
Details: A magical horse with a single horn on its forehead.

Name: Valkyries
Details: Mythical Norse female divinities who choose heroes to die in battle and carry them to the great Valhalla.

Name: Vampire
Details: Legend's most charming bloodsucker gets a whole section of this website all to itself.

Name: Wendigo
Details: An evil spirit that possesses humans and turns them into cannibals.

Name: Will-o'-the-wisp
Details: Strange flame-like lights that seem to beckon travelers to follow.

Name: Werewolf
Details: Human by day wolf by night.

Name: Wraith
Details: Evil spirits of the dead who are trapped on Earth.

Name: Zombie
Details: The living dead who feed on human flesh.
